content.raw:
One way you can avoid doing `catkin_make install` is by using [workspace overlays](http://wiki.ros.org/catkin/Tutorials/workspace_overlaying).  You can setup subT following the tutorials in a base workspace, but you'd put all your own code in a different (overlayed) workspace. You can then source the `install/setup.bash` of the base workspace before you build your new workspace. I think it might be easier to show with commands:

```
$ mkdir ~/base_ws
# follow instructions in the subT tutorial and install subT in base_ws
# at some point, the setup will include the following
$ source /opt/ros/melodic/setup.bash
$ catkin_make install

# Create a new workspace
# this is your new workspace and you'd do all your development here.
$ mkdir ~/overlay_ws
# This part is important. Source the base workspace from the **install** directory
$ source ~/base_ws/install/setup.bash
# Use catkin build or catkin_make. Note that you don't have to install.
$ catkin_make
# source your new workspace
$ source ~/overlay_ws/devel/setup.bash
# From this point forward your don't have to source the base workspace unless you clean (delete build and/or devel) your workspace.
```

This should work, but please beware of the warnings and limitations of ROS overlays from the [documentation](http://wiki.ros.org/catkin/Tutorials/workspace_overlaying).
